page.title: 06CUSTOMS IN RIPON
page.content: The Feast of Saint Wilfrid The feast of St.Wilfrid originated in a charter granted by King Henry 1st to Thomas Archbishop of York in 1108 and was a fair for four days in April.Now it is held in July/August and is extended by a fortnight. The main part of the feast is on the Saturday before the first Monday in August and celebrates the return of St.Wilfrid from exile in 686.Two Hundred years ago it was customary for someone representing St.Wilfrid to be taken away the day before the procession and be brought back on the appointed day. Clubs,schools,shops,local firms and public houses all build floats on various themes,eg,Robin Hood,nursery rhymes,the wild west and the good old days.The best float that is built recieves a prize.
